name: briwat kaab ghzal
ingredients: Dough for Kaab Ghzal (Flour, butter, lukewarm water, orange blossom water, sugar, egg, salt)
Almond filling (Ground almonds, melted butter, sugar, cinnamon, orange blossom water, gum arabic)
Brick pastry sheets (or homemade thin dough)
steps: Prepare the dough: Mix the flour, butter, salt, and liquids (water, orange blossom water, egg). Knead. Let it rest.
Prepare the filling: Mix the ground almonds, melted butter, sugar, cinnamon, and orange blossom water. Shape into small logs or balls.
If using homemade dough, roll it out very thinly and cut into squares. If using brick pastry sheets, cut into strips.
Place a small amount of filling on the dough/strip. Fold into a triangle or roll (like briouates). Seal with a bit of beaten egg or by tucking the end into the fold.
Fry the briouates in hot oil until golden.
Drain and immediately dip them into warm honey.
Let them drain and sprinkle with sesame seeds (optional). Serve cold.
